detaileddescription.para: String containing the CVS revision. Read out via reflection!
The current crossover rate used by this crossover operator (mutual exclusive to m_crossoverRatePercent and m_crossoverRateCalc).
Crossover rate in percentage of population size (mutual exclusive to m_crossoverRate and m_crossoverRateCalc).
Calculator for dynamically determining the crossover rate (mutual exclusive to m_crossoverRate and m_crossoverRatePercent)
true: x-over before and after a randomly chosen x-over point false: only x-over after the chosen point.
true: also x-over chromosomes with age of zero (newly created chromosomes)

Constructs a new instance of this CrossoverOperator without a specified crossover rate, this results in dynamic crossover rate being turned off. This means that the crossover rate will be fixed at populationsize/2.
Attention: The configuration used is the one set with the static method Genotype.setConfiguration.

Constructs a new instance of this CrossoverOperator without a specified crossover rate, this results in dynamic crossover rate being turned off. This means that the crossover rate will be fixed at populationsize/2.

memberdef.argsstring: (IChromosome firstMate, IChromosome secondMate, List a_candidateChromosomes, RandomGenerator generator)
memberdef.name: doCrossover

detaileddescription.para: Sets the crossover rate calculator.

parameterdescription.para: the new calculator

detaileddescription.para: The crossover operator randomly selects two Chromosomes from the population and "mates" them by randomly picking a gene and then swapping that gene and all subsequent genes between the two Chromosomes. The two modified Chromosomes are then added to the list of candidate Chromosomes.
If you work with CompositeGenes, this operator expects them to contain genes of the same type (e.g. IntegerGene). If you have mixed types, please provide your own crossover operator.

This CrossoverOperator supports both fixed and dynamic crossover rates. A fixed rate is one specified at construction time by the user. This operation is performed 1/m_crossoverRate as many times as there are Chromosomes in the population. Another possibility is giving the crossover rate as a percentage. A dynamic rate is determined by this class on the fly if no fixed rate is provided.
